00053 #define __CUSTOMSNMPAPP_C
00054 
00055 #include "TCPIP Stack/TCPIP.h"
00056 #include "MainDemo.h"
00057 
00058 #if defined(STACK_USE_SNMP_SERVER)
00059 
00060 #if !defined(SNMP_TRAP_DISABLED)
00061 /*
00062  * Trap information.
00063  * This table maintains list of intereseted receivers
00064  * who should receive notifications when some interesting
00065  * event occurs.
00066  */
00067 #define TRAP_TABLE_SIZE         (2)
00068 #define MAX_COMMUNITY_LEN       (8)
00069 typedef struct _TRAP_INFO
00070 {
00071    BYTE Size;
00072    struct
00073    {
00074        BYTE communityLen;
00075        char community[MAX_COMMUNITY_LEN];
00076        IP_ADDR IPAddress;
00077        struct
00078        {
00079            unsigned int bEnabled : 1;
00080        } Flags;
00081    } table[TRAP_TABLE_SIZE];
00082 } TRAP_INFO;
00083 
00084 /*
00085  * Initialize trap table with no entries.
00086  */
00087 TRAP_INFO trapInfo = { TRAP_TABLE_SIZE };
00088 
00089 static BOOL SendNotification(BYTE receiverIndex, SNMP_ID var, SNMP_VAL val)
00090 {
00091     static enum { SM_PREPARE, SM_NOTIFY_WAIT } smState = SM_PREPARE;
00092     IP_ADDR IPAddress;
00093 
00094     // Convert local to network order.
00095     IPAddress.v[0] = trapInfo.table[receiverIndex].IPAddress.v[3];
00096     IPAddress.v[1] = trapInfo.table[receiverIndex].IPAddress.v[2];
00097     IPAddress.v[2] = trapInfo.table[receiverIndex].IPAddress.v[1];
00098     IPAddress.v[3] = trapInfo.table[receiverIndex].IPAddress.v[0];
00099 
00100     switch(smState)
00101     {
00102             case SM_PREPARE:
00103                 SNMPNotifyPrepare(&IPAddress,
00104                                   trapInfo.table[receiverIndex].community,
00105                                   trapInfo.table[receiverIndex].communityLen,
00106                                   MICROCHIP,            // Agent ID Var
00107                                   6,                    // Notification code
00108                                   (DWORD)TickGet());
00109                 smState = SM_NOTIFY_WAIT;
00110         
00111                 break;
00112         
00113             case SM_NOTIFY_WAIT:
00114                 if ( SNMPIsNotifyReady(&IPAddress) )
00115                 {
00116                     smState = SM_PREPARE;
00117                     SNMPNotify(var, val, 0);
00118                     return TRUE;
00119                 }
00120     }
00121     return FALSE;
00122 }
00123 
00124 void SNMPTrapDemo(void)
00125 {
00126     static BOOL lbNotify = FALSE;
00127     static BYTE i = 0;
00128     SNMP_VAL val;
00129 
00130     if ( BUTTON3_IO == 0 && !lbNotify )
00131         lbNotify = TRUE;
00132 
00133     if ( i == trapInfo.Size )
00134     {
00135         i = 0;
00136         lbNotify = FALSE;
00137     }
00138 
00139     if ( lbNotify )
00140     {
00141         if ( trapInfo.table[i].Flags.bEnabled )
00142         {
00143            val.byte = 0;
00144             if ( SendNotification(i, PUSH_BUTTON, val) )
00145                 i++;
00146         }
00147         else
00148             i++;
00149     }
00150 }
00151 #endif
00152 
00153 BOOL SNMPValidate(SNMP_ACTION SNMPAction, char* community)
00154 {
00155     return TRUE;
00156 }

00160 // Only dynamic variables with ASCII_STRING or OCTET_STRING data type
00161 // needs to be handled.
00162 BOOL SNMPIsValidSetLen(SNMP_ID var, BYTE len)
00163 {
00164     switch(var)
00165     {
00166     case TRAP_COMMUNITY:
00167         if ( len < MAX_COMMUNITY_LEN+1 )
00168             return TRUE;
00169         break;
00170 
00171 #if defined(USE_LCD)
00172     case LCD_DISPLAY:
00173         if ( len < sizeof(LCDText)+1 )
00174             return TRUE;
00175         break;
00176 #endif
00177     }
00178     return FALSE;
00179 }
00180 
00181 
00182 // Only dynamic read-write variables needs to be handled.
00183 BOOL SNMPSetVar(SNMP_ID var, SNMP_INDEX index, BYTE ref, SNMP_VAL val)
00184 {
00185     switch(var)
00186     {
00187     case LED_D5:
00188         LED1_IO = val.byte;
00189         return TRUE;
00190 
00191     case LED_D6:
00192         LED2_IO = val.byte;
00193         return TRUE;
00194 
00195     case TRAP_RECEIVER_IP:
00196         // Make sure that index is within our range.
00197         if ( index < trapInfo.Size )
00198         {
00199             // This is just an update to an existing entry.
00200             trapInfo.table[index].IPAddress.Val = val.dword;
00201             return TRUE;
00202         }
00203         else if ( index < TRAP_TABLE_SIZE )
00204         {
00205             // This is an addition to table.
00206             trapInfo.table[index].IPAddress.Val = val.dword;
00207             trapInfo.table[index].communityLen = 0;
00208             trapInfo.Size++;
00209             return TRUE;
00210         }
00211         break;
00212 
00213     case TRAP_RECEIVER_ENABLED:
00214         // Make sure that index is within our range.
00215         if ( index < trapInfo.Size )
00216         {
00217             // Value of '1' means Enabled".
00218             if ( val.byte == 1 )
00219                 trapInfo.table[index].Flags.bEnabled = 1;
00220             // Value of '0' means "Disabled.
00221             else if ( val.byte == 0 )
00222                 trapInfo.table[index].Flags.bEnabled = 0;
00223             else
00224                 // This is unknown value.
00225                 return FALSE;
00226             return TRUE;
00227         }
00228         // Given index is more than our current table size.
00229         // If it is within our range, treat it as an addition to table.
00230         else if ( index < TRAP_TABLE_SIZE )
00231         {
00232             // Treat this as an addition to table.
00233             trapInfo.Size++;
00234             trapInfo.table[index].communityLen = 0;
00235         }
00236 
00237         break;
00238 
00239     case TRAP_COMMUNITY:
00240         // Since this is a ASCII_STRING data type, SNMP will call with
00241         // SNMP_END_OF_VAR to indicate no more bytes.
00242         // Use this information to determine if we just added new row
00243         // or updated an existing one.
00244         if ( ref ==  SNMP_END_OF_VAR )
00245         {
00246             // Index equal to table size means that we have new row.
00247             if ( index == trapInfo.Size )
00248                 trapInfo.Size++;
00249 
00250             // Length of string is one more than index.
00251             trapInfo.table[index].communityLen++;
00252 
00253             return TRUE;
00254         }
00255 
00256         // Make sure that index is within our range.
00257         if ( index < trapInfo.Size )
00258         {
00259             // Copy given value into local buffer.
00260             trapInfo.table[index].community[ref] = val.byte;
00261             // Keep track of length too.
00262             // This may not be NULL terminate string.
00263             trapInfo.table[index].communityLen = (BYTE)ref;
00264             return TRUE;
00265         }
00266         break;
00267 
00268 #if defined(USE_LCD)
00269     case LCD_DISPLAY:
00270         // Copy all bytes until all bytes are transferred
00271         if ( ref != SNMP_END_OF_VAR )
00272         {
00273             LCDText[ref] = val.byte;
00274             LCDText[ref+1] = 0;
00275         }
00276         else
00277         {
00278                         LCDUpdate();
00279         }
00280 
00281         return TRUE;
00282 #endif
00283 
00284     }
00285 
00286     return FALSE;
00287 }
00288 
00289 // Only sequence index needs to be handled in this function.
00290 BOOL SNMPGetNextIndex(SNMP_ID var, SNMP_INDEX *index)
00291 {
00292     SNMP_INDEX tempIndex;
00293 
00294     tempIndex = *index;
00295 
00296     switch(var)
00297     {
00298     case TRAP_RECEIVER_ID:
00299         // There is no next possible index if table itself is empty.
00300         if ( trapInfo.Size == 0 )
00301             return FALSE;
00302 
00303         // INDEX_INVALID means start with first index.
00304         if ( tempIndex == SNMP_INDEX_INVALID )
00305         {
00306             *index = 0;
00307             return TRUE;
00308         }
00309         else if ( tempIndex < (trapInfo.Size-1) )
00310         {
00311             *index = tempIndex+1;
00312             return TRUE;
00313         }
00314         break;
00315     }
00316     return FALSE;
00317 }
00318 
00319 
00320 BOOL SNMPGetVar(SNMP_ID var, SNMP_INDEX index, BYTE *ref, SNMP_VAL* val)
00321 {
00322     BYTE myRef;
00323 
00324     myRef = *ref;
00325 
00326     switch(var)
00327     {
00328     case SYS_UP_TIME:
00329         val->dword = TickGet();
00330         return TRUE;
00331 
00332     case LED_D5:
00333         val->byte = LED1_IO;
00334         return TRUE;
00335 
00336     case LED_D6:
00337         val->byte = LED2_IO;
00338         return TRUE;
00339 
00340     case PUSH_BUTTON:
00341         // There is only one button - meaning only index of 0 is allowed.
00342         val->byte = BUTTON0_IO;
00343         return TRUE;
00344 
00345     case ANALOG_POT0:
00346         val->word = atoi((char*)AN0String);
00347         return TRUE;
00348 
00349     case TRAP_RECEIVER_ID:
00350         if ( index < trapInfo.Size )
00351         {
00352             val->byte = index;
00353             return TRUE;
00354         }
00355         break;
00356 
00357     case TRAP_RECEIVER_ENABLED:
00358         if ( index < trapInfo.Size )
00359         {
00360             val->byte = trapInfo.table[index].Flags.bEnabled;
00361             return TRUE;
00362         }
00363         break;
00364 
00365     case TRAP_RECEIVER_IP:
00366         if ( index < trapInfo.Size )
00367         {
00368             val->dword = trapInfo.table[index].IPAddress.Val;
00369             return TRUE;
00370         }
00371         break;
00372 
00373     case TRAP_COMMUNITY:
00374         if ( index < trapInfo.Size )
00375         {
00376             if ( trapInfo.table[index].communityLen == 0 )
00377                 *ref = SNMP_END_OF_VAR;
00378             else
00379             {
00380                 val->byte = trapInfo.table[index].community[myRef];
00381 
00382                 myRef++;
00383 
00384                 if ( myRef == trapInfo.table[index].communityLen )
00385                     *ref = SNMP_END_OF_VAR;
00386                 else
00387                     *ref = myRef;
00388             }
00389             return TRUE;
00390         }
00391         break;
00392 
00393 #if defined(USE_LCD)
00394     case LCD_DISPLAY:
00395         if ( LCDText[0] == 0 )
00396             myRef = SNMP_END_OF_VAR;
00397         else
00398         {
00399             val->byte = LCDText[myRef++];
00400             if ( LCDText[myRef] == 0 )
00401                 myRef = SNMP_END_OF_VAR;
00402         }
00403 
00404         *ref = myRef;
00405         return TRUE;
00406 #endif
00407     }
00408 
00409     return FALSE;
00410 }
00411 #endif  //#if defined(STACK_USE_SNMP_SERVER)
